body.p: Although non‑transferability often results in the early exercise of employee share options, some employees can mitigate the effects of non‑transferability, because they are able, in effect, to sell the options or protect themselves from future changes in the value of the options by selling or buying other derivatives. For example, the employee might be able, in effect, to sell an employee share option by entering into an arrangement with an investment bank whereby the employee sells a similar call option to the bank, ie an option with the same exercise price and term. A zero‑cost collar is one means of obtaining protection from changes in the value of an employee share option, by selling a call option and buying a put option.
